content: American songwriterMusical artist **Tat Tong**; born **Tong Hong Tat**; is a Singaporean record producer and songwriter who is based in [Los Angeles](/wiki/Los_Angeles). His discography has gone 80× platinum, with over 20 #1 hits out of over 60 Top 20 hits worldwide. As a producer-songwriter, Tong's portfolio spans North America, Central/South America, Europe, Asia, and Australia, including artists like [Luis Fonsi](/wiki/Luis_Fonsi), [Troye Sivan](/wiki/Troye_Sivan), [Hailee Steinfeld](/wiki/Hailee_Steinfeld), [Monsta X](/wiki/Monsta_X), [Kaskade](/wiki/Kaskade), [CNCO](/wiki/CNCO), [Sebastian Yatra](/wiki/Sebastian_Yatra), [CD9](/wiki/CD9_(band)), [Aitana](/wiki/Aitana_(singer)), [ShiNEE](/wiki/Shinee), [JJ Lin](/wiki/JJ_Lin), [Vanness Wu](/wiki/Vanness_Wu), and [Wang Lee Hom](/wiki/Wang_Leehom). He is also a lyricist for the upcoming Warner Brothers-produced Broadway musical "Crazy Rich Asians: The Musical", alongside lyricist [Amanda Green](/wiki/Amanda_Green), songwriter [Helen Park](/wiki/Helen_Park), and book writer [Leah Nanako Winkler](/wiki/Leah_Nanako_Winkler). ## Early life Growing up in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), Tong studied piano and composition at [Yamaha Music Foundation](/wiki/Yamaha_Music_Foundation). In 2001, he accepted a scholarship from the [Singapore Armed Forces](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces) to study [Computer Science](/wiki/Computer_Science) at [Cornell University](/wiki/Cornell_University) in [Ithaca, NY](/wiki/Ithaca,_NY), and following that, served his scholarship bond in the [Republic of Singapore Navy](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Navy) for 6 years before transitioning into a full-time music career in 2011. At Cornell, Tong sang in the [Cornell University Glee Club](/wiki/Cornell_University_Glee_Club). ## Current career Tong co-produced and co-wrote [Troye Sivan](/wiki/Troye_Sivan)'s "[Happy Little Pill](/wiki/Happy_Little_Pill)" from his 2014 [TRXYE](/wiki/TRXYE) album, which was certified Gold in Australia, charted at #1 on iTunes in 55 countries, and reached #5 on the [Billboard 200](/wiki/Billboard_200) chart, making him the first Singaporean to have an entry in the Top 10 of the [Billboard 200](/wiki/Billboard_200). He also cowrote American DJ [Elephante](/wiki/Elephante)'s single "Age Of Innocence" featuring [Trouze](/wiki/Trouze) and [Damon Sharpe](/wiki/Damon_Sharpe) which charted in the Top 20 on the Billboard Dance charts. In the Latin music space, Tong co-produced and co-wrote the Mandarin remix of "[Despacito](/wiki/Despacito)" by [Luis Fonsi](/wiki/Luis_Fonsi) featuring [JJ Lin](/wiki/JJ_Lin). He also co-wrote "Apaga La Luz" from [Fonsi](/wiki/Luis_Fonsi)'s 2019 album "[Vida](/wiki/Vida_(Luis_Fonsi_album))" which was nominated for Best Latin Pop Album in the 62nd Grammy Awards, reached #1 on Billboard's US Top Latin Albums and US Latin Pop Albums, #18 on the Billboard 200, and was certified 22× platinum in the United States. He co-wrote and co-produced "Estoy Enamorado De Ti" from [CNCO's self-titled 2018 album](/wiki/CNCO_(album)) which reached #1 on Billboard's US Top Latin Albums, #33 on the Billboard 200, and was certified platinum in the United States. He also co-produced and co-wrote [CD9](/wiki/CD9)'s 2016 album "Evolution" with [Jovany Javier](/wiki/Jovany_Javier) as well as [Luis Salazar](/wiki/Luis_Salazar) of The Dro1dz, which was certified platinum and charted at #1 in Mexico. Tong's global credits with [The Swaggernautz](/wiki/The_Swaggernautz) also include work with [Santana](/wiki/Santana_(band)), [Pitbull](/wiki/Pitbull_(rapper)), [Project 46](/wiki/Project_46), [A-mei](/wiki/A-mei), [Karen Mok](/wiki/Karen_Mok), [Show Lo](/wiki/Show_Lo), [2PM](/wiki/2PM), [Vanness Wu](/wiki/Vanness_Wu), [Coco Lee](/wiki/Coco_Lee), [JJ Lin](/wiki/JJ_Lin), and [Kit Chan](/wiki/Kit_Chan). Tong is also a speaker and co-host of the Gamechangers Music Seminar series, and is a noted producer in the contemporary a cappella community. ## Awards - COMPASS (Composers and Authors Society of Singapore) 'Wings Of Excellence' Award for overseas achievements - COMPASS (Composers and Authors Society of Singapore) 'Top Local English Pop Song' Award for 'Happy Little Pill' (Troye Sivan) ## Partial discography - [Luis Fonsi](/wiki/Luis_Fonsi), [JJ Lin](/wiki/JJ_Lin): "Despacito (Mandarin Remix)", [Universal Music Latin Entertainment](/wiki/Capitol_Records) - [Luis Fonsi](/wiki/Luis_Fonsi): "Apaga La Luz", [Universal Music Latin Entertainment](/wiki/Capitol_Records) - [CNCO](/wiki/CNCO): "Estoy Enamorado De Ti", [Sony Music Latin](/wiki/Sony_Music_Latin) - [Monsta X](/wiki/Monsta_X), [Sebastian Yatra](/wiki/Sebastian_Yatra): "Magnetic", [Universal Music Latin Entertainment](/wiki/Universal_Music_Latin_Entertainment) - [ShiNEE](/wiki/Shinee): "Tell Me Your Name", [SM Entertainment](/wiki/SM_Entertainment) - [Troye Sivan](/wiki/Troye_Sivan): "Happy Little Pill", [Universal Music Latin Entertainment](/wiki/Capitol_Records) - [JJ Lin](/wiki/JJ_Lin): "Resurgence", [Warner Music Taiwan](/wiki/Warner_Music_Taiwan) - [JJ Lin](/wiki/JJ_Lin): "Sanctuary", [Warner Music Taiwan](/wiki/Warner_Music_Taiwan) - [Vanness Wu](/wiki/Vanness_Wu): "Rang Wo Geng Ai Wo", [Sony Music Taiwan](/wiki/Sony_Music) - [Wang Leehom](/wiki/Wang_Leehom): "World Without Tears" - [Kaskade](/wiki/Kaskade): "Come Play With Me", Arkade - [Elephante](/wiki/Elephante) feat.
